byline.contributor: Omar Al-Jawoshy reported from Baghdad, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Kareem Fahim contributed reporting from Cairo, and Rukmini Callimachi from New York.
byline.original: By OMAR AL-JAWOSHY and RICK GLADSTONE

abstract: Islamic State issues series of statements claiming significant gains against Iraqi forces that are attempting to take back Ramadi; Iraqi officials refute announcement, which broke unusual silence from militant group.
lead_paragraph: The Islamic State said it completed deadly strikes in response to a military assault to retake Ramadi, though Iraqi officials denied they suffered major casualties.

headline.main: ISIS Claims Major Counterattacks as Iraqi Forces Lay Siege to Ramadi
headline.print_headline: Amid Siege, ISIS Claims Deadly Strikes in Ramadi

snippet: The Islamic State said it completed deadly strikes in response to a military assault to retake Ramadi, though Iraqi officials denied they suffered major casualties.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
